title: Embedded developer
description:
*Icomera is a leading global innovator in connectivity solutions within the transportation sector. We are at the forefront of transforming public transport, making it smarter, safer, greener, and more connected than ever before. At Icomera you work with products used by many users around the world, including passengers on some of the world’s largest train and bus operators.*


*Are you looking for a new and challenge and want to make sure it is an exciting one? Our embedded team is looking for a new team member!*


Job type: Full-time  

Workplace conditions: Hybrid  

Location: Gothenburg, Sweden


About the Role:


As an Embedded Software Developer at Icomera, you will help develop the next generation of network routers for vehicles. The embedded team is responsible for analysis, design, implementation, and testing of the router OS as well as its applications. You’ll work closely with hardware and web development teams, contributing to innovative solutions that are visible to millions of passengers around the world. If you enjoy working on the Linux platform, networking, and tackling firmware or hardware challenges, this is the role for you!


Key responsibilities:


* Write high-quality code with focus on performance and maintainability.
* Communicate with and support team members and other stakeholders within the business.
* Follow established development processes and related standards.
* Contribute to a positive working environment and help optimise performance of the team.


Requirements:


* sc / M.sc degree, in computer science, physics or equivalent.
* 3+ years of Linux-based software development experience in an agile environment (C/C++, Bash).
* Deep knowledge of computer networking.
* Passion for the Linux platform and software development.
* Proficient in English, written and spoken. Working proficiency in Swedish, written and spoken, is a plus
  


Who You Are:


To thrive in this role, you enjoy working with people and you are excited to be part of a constantly evolving international company. As an Embedded Software Developer, you are honest, driven, and solution-oriented, and you enjoy tackling technical challenges as part of a team.


Our Offer:


— The opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a market leader where we design and build everything in-house—from hardware to software


— Health is important – we offer a comprehensive health benefit program to our employees


— Flexible work arrangements – work from our modern and central office locations, or work from home up to two days a week


— Electrical bike lease agreement via net salary deduction


— ITP Pension and collective bargaining agreement


— A social work environment – board game nights, after works, seasonal parties… The list goes on!


*Ready to be part of something exciting and make a real difference in the connected future of transport? We’d love to hear from you!*


***Interested? !***


More about the position:


We will be reviewing applicants ongoing. Icomera welcomes candidates from all backgrounds, and we value a diverse and inclusive work environment.


Icomera is an employer with a collective agreement with TechSverige. If you have questions to our local union representatives, you may contact them at unionen@icomera.com or saco@icomera.com.


*About Icomera:*


Icomera is the world’s leading provider of integrated connectivity solutions for trains, trams, buses, and coaches, serving millions of passengers and tens of thousands of vehicles on a daily basis. The IcoCrew now consist of 300+ employees globally. Icomera is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, with main offices in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Ireland, and Italy.


Icomera’s vision for green mobility within the public transport industry perfectly complements the wider mission of our parent company, Equans. As the global leader in multi-technical services with 74,000 employees working across 17 country hubs, Equans delivers customised solutions which connect, protect and energise territories, cities, buildings, industries and transport infrastructures, empowering their energy, industrial and digital transitions. Visit www.icomera.com for further information.
  
We are always looking for the best talent. Icomera is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden, with main offices in the United Kingdom, Germany, France, Italy, the United States, and Canada. We are happy to accept applications from anyone who already has the right to work in these countries (for example, EU citizenship).



To apply, please follow the links included in the role descriptions above.



We only engage in direct recruitment; calls or CVs received via recruitment agencies will not be accepted.

title: Data Engineer / Cloud Developer within Advanced Analytics
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.  


**Role Summary**  

We are now looking for a seasoned developer within Data Engineering to strengthen the Product Analytics team within the Connected Analytics unit. You will be working as part of an agile team to enable various units within TRATON R&D worldwide in accessing comprehensive amounts of connected vehicle data and create data products, self-service analytics and visualizations based on the data of a fleet of several hundred thousand vehicles. As part of the team, you will participate in the short- and long-term planning of deliveries and technologies, the prioritization and according implementation.  

In your role, you will bring in your competence and efforts to continuously improve and scale the toolset through which we create data availability and insights for the various consumers within TRATON R&D. You will cooperate with data providers and consumers alike (data engineers, data scientists and AI experts, engineers, analysts, statisticians, product and service owners) and develop high quality data products and self-service in a sustainable and scalable way.  


**Job Responsibilities**  

* Scale up and continuously improve the toolset to enable advanced analytics and data sharing for TRATON R&D
* Develop data products and create insights based on connected vehicle data
* Take ownership for the complete life-cycle of the solutions you create, from requirements, planning, implementation to maintenance and continuous improvements
* Accelerate and scale the team’s efforts by applying latest technologies and methods
* Contribute to the continuous improvement process of the team and share your knowledge to support the journey to being a data-driven and AI-ready company
* Ensure reliable, scalable and cyber secure solutions by applying and continuously improving the team’s DevSecOps methods
* Keep a clear focus on efficiency, managing the balance between cost, customer value and elimination of waste
  


**Who You Are**

As a person, you are analytical and communicative. Establishing a personal network within the organization to find the best possible solution to a problem is easy for you. You embrace diversity and cooperation and are experienced in mentoring and leading teams. You have a supportive mindset when engaging stakeholders and consumers of your solutions, and like to put in an extra effort for satisfied customers.  

In your career, you have worked with large scale data sets and industrial solutions in cloud environments. You show professional habits and skills when it comes to tooling, coding, testing, deploying and documentation. You have a proven track record in at least some of the relevant areas of the field such as cloud data warehouses, data processing, statistics, data science and analytics, data- and ML-pipelining, DevSecOps, cloud infrastructure and agile development.  

Having worked with operational vehicle data, diagnostic data, geospatial data, or comparable large data sets in similar industries is a merit; as is leadership experience as Scrum Master, Project Lead or similar.  

Your work is based on the following (or comparable) skills and tooling (examples): Python / SQL / C#, AWS, CICD, Gitlab, Grafana, Snowflake, Databricks, Azure AD, front-end development (e.g. Vue) and visualization, statistics and analytics (e.g. SAS Viya, Power-BI).  

You have an academic education at university level in computer science, engineering physics, electrical engineering or equivalent work experience. You communicate fluently in English, in both speech and writing.  


**This Is Us**  

Our unit is part of the Connected Vehicle Data and Analytics section within the Cloud Embedded Platform domain of TRATON R&D, which is the global development organization for the brands Scania and MAN in Europe and the brand International in the US. With our global organization, we deliver innovative and sustainable solutions with the customer value at the heart of everything.  

The team Product Analytics is part of a line- and flow-organization which is working globally according to SAFe. We ensure that TRATON R&D has access to the data and analytics capabilities needed for informed decision making.  

Within our organization, we value a culture of collaboration and learning, with respect for the individual. As a member of the team, you have the opportunity to shape your work and the future of the transportation industry with us.  

**Scania Offers**  

We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.

Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.  

**Application**

Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.

Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-08-01. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.

If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:  

Frank Deubzer, Group Manager, frank.deubzer@scania.com

We look forward to your application!

title: ZoCom söker en senior .NET-utvecklare till kunduppdrag
description:
##### **Är du en erfaren backend-utvecklare eller vill du ta nästa steg i din professionella utveckling? ZoCom växlar upp och behöver nya starka lagspelare med kompetens inom Java/C#/.NET/Python, såväl anställd hos oss och som underkonsult i eget bolag.**

  

ZoCom är ett utveckling-, utbildning & innovationsbolag, och brinner för webb- & systemutveckling. Med över 10-års erfarenhet har vi jobbat med allt från mindre företag och startups till stora organisationer. Med kontor i både Stockholm & Göteborg hjälper vi våra kunder att få bästa möjliga resultat!


Vi är en platt organisation där våra medarbetare är en del av vår ZoCom-familj! Vår super-power är att arbeta utifrån vilka vi har i teamet istället för tvärtom, vilket är en central del i allt vi gör. Detta har skapat en stark kultur av tillhörighet, laganda och personlig utveckling. Flera av våra duktiga utvecklare har dessutom kompetenser som gör att de kan välja mellan utveckling- eller utbildningsuppdrag, något som ytterligare stärker ZoCom som organisation.

### **Om dig**


Vi söker backend-utvecklare som har en yrkeshögskole-/högskoleutbildning inom något utav Java/.NET/C#/Python och har **minst fem års professionell erfarenhet** inom backendutveckling.


Vi tror att du kan komplettera oss med din expertis inom något av dessa områden:

* + .NET/C#
	+ ASP.NET
	+ Docker
	+ Kubernetes
	+ API-utveckling
	+ Visual Studio
	+ SQL eller andra databaser
	+ Python
	+ Azure/AWS eller andra relevanta molnplattformar
	+ Java SE & Java EE
	+ Microservices arkitektur (Docker/Kubernetes)
	+ Verktyg som Git, Jenkins etc.
	+ Erfarenhet av agila metoder, exempelvis Scrum eller Kanban (certifieringar är extra meriterande

  

För att söka till oss behöver du även ha flytande kunskap i svenska & engelska, både i tal & skrift. **Vi vill att CV som du skickar in är på svenska.**

### **Personliga egenskaper**


För att du ska trivas i ZoCom-familjen är det viktigt att du brinner för utveckling (precis som vi), är trygg inom ditt kompetensområde och är bra på att samarbeta/kommunicera. Vi tror på en ärlig och transparent dialog med dig för att utvecklas tillsammans. Som person är du flexibel, strukturerad och engagerad. Vi ser även att du gillar att skapa nya relationer såväl som att utveckla befintliga relationer, vilket gör att du gärna ser dig själv som en ambassadör.

### **Vad vi erbjuder dig**


Som konsult via ZoCom får du mer än bara ett uppdrag – du blir en del av ett engagerat och drivet konsultbolag där personlig utveckling och goda relationer står i fokus. Vi erbjuder spännande uppdrag i dynamiska miljöer, personlig matchning utifrån dina mål och kompetenser, samt trygghet och transparens i samarbetet, oavsett om du är anställd eller frilansar. Vi följer dig genom uppdraget och erbjuder stöd, uppföljning och tillgång till ett nätverk av andra kompetenta konsulter. Hos oss är du aldrig bara en resurs – du är en viktig del av teamet.  

  

Vårt intresse är att matcha dina kompetenser och ambitioner för nya spännande utmaningar!

### **Om rollen**


Placering:


Arbetstider: Enligt uppdrag


Lön: Enligt överenskommelse


För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Theódóra Loftsdóttir på theodora.loftsdottir@zocom.se

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We're looking for a Software Engineer with a focus on AI/ML and strong in Python, Java, and Kubernetes skills. Join our data and analytics team in Stockholm at Sinch Operator Software to help unlock valuable insights from traffic data, empowering mobile network operators and driving smarter customer solutions.
   

  

* Collaborate closely with product management to translate AI/ML requirements into actionable solutions and code, working alongside the team on implementation.
* Design, develop, and deploy AI/ML models and data pipelines to analyze and extract insights from large-scale traffic data.
* Team player who is eager to assist and coach others as well as open to asking for support from others.


**Requirements**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field.
* Strong programming skills in Python and Java.
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes.
* Proficient with AI/ML libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, Pandas, and NumPy.
* Experience in Jupyter Notebook for data analysis.
* Familiarity with MLFlow is a plus.
* Collaborative mindset in supporting others and communicating clearly within the team.


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in
 **English** 
 .
   

  

**OUR HIRING PROCESS**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Frontend-utvecklare
description:
We’re now looking for an outstanding frontend developer to join our team with
 **proven expertise in design and user experience** 
 — someone who builds interfaces that not only look great but feel effortless to use. You have at least 5 years of experience building modern, responsive interfaces. You care about how things look, feel, and perform — and you bring that to life through code.
 



  





 You work comfortably with tools like Cursor and CoPilot, but also know when it’s faster (and better) to code on your own. You value reusable components over reinventing the wheel, and you're skilled at working with Tailwind and established design systems — but when something needs to be built from scratch, you write clean, thoughtful code.
 



  





 We use Figma daily for design collaboration, and expect you to be confident navigating, interpreting, and implementing designs from Figma — and also comfortable offering input when needed.
 



 We’re a fast-growing tech company with 22 people across Stockholm and Vilnius. We ship fast and often, and care deeply about clarity, usability and code quality. Most of us work together from our centrally located Stockholm office — because we believe energy and ideas flow better in person. That said, working from home a day or two a week, or from somewhere remote for a short time, is totally fine.
 



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 - 5+ years of experience in modern frontend development
 



 - Strong design instincts and a high bar for UX/UI
 



 - Strong grasp of code structure, maintainability and performance
 



 - Strong sense of ownership and ability to work independently
 



 - Practical mindset: reuse where it makes sense, build when it matters
 



 - Fluent in Swedish and English (professional or native level)
 



 - Based in or around Stockholm
 



 – Self-motivated / Independent
 



 – Ownership mindset
 



  





**Bonus if you have** 




 – Experience in fast-paced product teams
 



 – Comfort working with backend tools (especially Python or Graph APIs)
 



 – Additional European languages
 



  





**How to apply** 




 No long cover letter needed — just send a few lines about yourself and a link to your work or profile.
 



  





**Questions?** 




 Contact Knut at knut@fastighetsloggen.se

title: Software Engineer
description:
Are you passionate about APIs and ready to shape the future of API management? Join us to work with cutting-edge technology, drive innovation, and take your skills to the next level!
   

  

 Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate. Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will be an integral part of the API Team, enabling customers to access Tele2 services via APIs from various frontend channels. Our mission is to deliver an exceptional experience for both consumer and business customers by providing the necessary data they need. We offer services that allow data to be consumed by other applications and systems, managing these services from start to finish. Our team operates within the Microsoft stack, fostering a culture where teamwork and inclusion are paramount.
   

  

 Your tasks and responsibilities will include (but are not limited to):
   

  

* Developing and maintaining APIs built in .Net
* Managing and maintaining Azure API Management
* Overseeing the internal developer portal Backstage
* Communicating and supporting numerous stakeholders as a central component
* Providing specialist support across the organization for API management
* Sharing your expertise with the team and learning new skills from others
* Adhering to patterns that promote robust services and continuously improving the team’s capabilities


**What we look for:**
 We are a collaborative team that works closely with other backend and frontend teams to coordinate our efforts. Maintaining strong relationships with architects and being able to navigate unclear information to create our own requirements is crucial.
   

  

 To be successful in this role and a good fit for our team, you should have a strong ambition to develop new functionalities while managing and maintaining existing solutions.
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we believe that you have:**
* At least some years of experience in API development using .Net
* Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms
* Knowledge of Docker, deploy pipelines, and Kubernetes terminology
* Some experience with JavaScript/React for working with Backstage
* Basic knowledge of security concepts (encryption with keys, SSL/TLS, HTTPS)
* A proactive and curious mindset

title: Frontend Developer - Growth Web
description:
**Join Aira's mission to transform Europe's energy future**
 Are you passionate about building exceptional web experiences that drive growth and build iconic brands? Join Aira, a pioneering Swedish tech company, and help us craft our digital front door with cutting-edge frontend technology!
   

  

 Aira is at the forefront of clean energy technology. 10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**We are now looking for a talented Frontend Engineer to join our team in Stockholm, focusing on our public website and lead generation platform.**
 This is a unique opportunity to take technical ownership of our most visible platform, ensuring it not only converts visitors into leads but also consistently elevates our brand perception through high-performance, scalable web solutions.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
**Build high-converting web applications** 
 using React and Next.js that directly impact our lead generation and revenue goals. You'll own the technical implementation of our public website, ensuring every component drives measurable business results.
   

  

**Optimize** 
**for performance and conversions** 
 by implementing SEO best practices, managing Core Web Vitals, and building A/B testing infrastructure that enables data-driven decision making across marketing and product teams.
   

  

**Integrate headless CMS solutions** 
 to empower our content and marketing teams while maintaining developer velocity and site performance. You'll architect content workflows that scale with our rapid growth.
   

  

**Deploy and** 
**maintain** 
**production applications** 
 on Vercel, managing CI/CD pipelines, monitoring performance metrics, and ensuring 99.9% uptime for our mission-critical lead generation platform.
   

  

**Collaborate cross-functionally** 
 with product managers, designers, and data scientists to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions that support our goal of reaching 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**What You'll Bring To The Role**
* React & Next.js expertise - 3+ years building production applications with modern React patterns and Next.js features (SSR, SSG, ISR, API routes)
* Vercel deployment experience - Hands-on experience with Vercel's platform, edge functions, and performance optimization tools
* Headless CMS integration - Proven track record implementing Contentful, Sanity, Strapi, or similar headless solutions
* SEO mastery - Deep understanding of technical SEO, Core Web Vitals optimization, and search engine ranking factors
* A/B testing & CRO - Experience implementing testing frameworks (Optimizely, VWO, or similar) and analyzing conversion data
* Data-driven development - Proficiency with analytics tools and making technical decisions based on user behavior data


**Essential Skills:**
* TypeScript proficiency
* Advanced CSS skills (Tailwind CSS preferred)
* Experience with agile ways of working
* API integration and data fetching optimization
* Performance monitoring and debugging
* Multi-language/international website development


**Professional Requirements:**
* 4 days per week in our Stockholm office
* Strong English communication skills
* Experience working in fast-paced, growth-focused environments


**Please note**
 As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.
   

  

 Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!
   

  

**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth
* Work with cutting-edge frontend technologies and modern development practices
* Enjoy our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes walk away


 At Aira, we champion next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Dotnet Developer
description:
**Job Description:** 




 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **CRM/.NET Senior Developer** 
 with strong hands-on experience in
 **Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015** 
 and .NET technologies to join our team in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 .
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, develop, and implement custom features and enhancements within Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015.
* Develop plug-ins, workflows, and integrations using .NET technologies.
* Customize CRM entities, forms, views, dashboards, and reports as per business requirements.
* Collaborate with functional teams, business analysts, and stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver optimal technical solutions.
* Ensure high code quality through best practices, code reviews, and unit testing.
* Troubleshoot and resolve CRM application issues and performance bottlenecks.
* Participate in deployment and support activities.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* 6–8 years of hands-on experience in CRM and .NET development.
* Strong development expertise in
 **Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2015** 
 .
* Proficient in C#, .NET Framework, JavaScript, and Web Services.
* Experience with CRM customization and configuration.
* Familiarity with CRM SDKs, plugin development, and workflow extensions.
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Experience with upgrading or migrating CRM versions.
* Familiarity with Power Platform and Azure DevOps.
* Prior work experience in Swedish or European projects is a plus.

title: Fullstack / Frontend Developer - Installation and Customer Care
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer on our Installations & Customer Care team, you'll help transform how clean energy gets delivered by empowering the field workforce with intuitive, data-driven tools. You’ll work at the intersection of software and real-world impact, building solutions that help us improve our digital and operational processes and that help installers and technicians do their best work every day.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Build intelligent tools that replace manual paperwork and disconnected workflows with scalable digital solutions, bringing structure, traceability, and efficiency to field operations
* Develop services that simplify collaboration and handovers between installers, planners, and support teams, ensuring smooth transitions and fewer dropped balls across the customer journey
* Create platforms that collect and leverage operational data, helping us identify patterns, drive continuous improvement, and make smarter decisions at scale
* Design infrastructure that empowers a traditionally non-digital workforce to adopt and rely on intuitive tools, enabling them to focus on delivering high-quality installations
* Support post-installation care by enabling proactive maintenance, diagnostics, and revisit scheduling, improving long-term outcomes for both customers and the business
* Help us scale into new regions and markets by building flexible systems that adapt to varying local requirements, work practices, and service models


 We’re changing how clean energy is installed and maintained—making it smarter, faster, and better for everyone involved. If you’re a generalist, excited about solving problems and want to build systems that empower people in the field and drive tangible outcomes, this is the role for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
* Experience with React and TypeScript
* Solid experience with Java, or other object-oriented languages
* Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests, etc.)


**Nice to have**
* Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
* Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
* gRPC and Protobuf
* Terraform
* Kanban, Scrum, and/or a combination of both
* Digitalization and modernisation of manual labour
* Framework experience with Spring Boot


****Please note:****
****As summer is a time when many of our team members are on vacation, our recruitment process will be slower than usual. We may not be able to review applications and start interviewing until early August, once everyone is back.****
****Thank you for your patience and understanding. We truly appreciate your interest in joining us, and we look forward to connecting with you soon!****
**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy the flexibility of our hybrid work model and discover our brand-new office at Norra Stationsgatan 93 in Stockholm. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan and Odenplan stations just a few minutes' walk away


 At Aira, we champion the next-generation energy as well as diversity and inclusion. We firmly believe that a diverse workforce fosters innovation and creativity, enhancing our ability to serve customers and communities effectively. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. Our commitment is to uphold equality and inclusivity, fostering a collaborative environment where everyone can thrive and contribute to a better future for our people and the planet.

title: Backend Developer - Billing & Subscriptions
description:
10% of Europe's CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating, and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we're making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany, and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Backend Engineer on our Billing & Subscriptions team, you'll build the robust systems that power how customers pay for and manage their clean energy solutions. You'll focus on creating secure, scalable backend services that handle billing, payments, and subscription management across multiple markets.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

  

* Design and build APIs and backend services for billing, payments, and subscription management
* Integrate with payment gateways, banks, and third-party financial services
* Develop automated billing systems, invoice generation, and subscription lifecycle management
* Create secure, scalable systems that handle financial data and transactions
* Build internal tools and services that support our finance operations
* Help scale our payment infrastructure across multiple markets and currencies


 We're making clean energy financing simple and reliable. If you enjoy building robust backend systems that handle mission-critical financial operations, this role is for you.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Experience with Java (Spring framework preferred)
* Strong understanding of databases and data modeling
* Experience building APIs and backend services
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality, well-tested code
* Interest in financial systems and payment processing


**Nice to have:**

* Security best practices for financial systems
* Experience at fast-growing companies
* Knowledge of microservices architecture


**What is in it for you?**
* Work at a fast-growing clean energy company making a real environmental impact
* Collaborate with international teams and launch products globally
* Build systems that directly impact our core business operations
* Hybrid work flexibility at our new Stockholm office near public transport
* Supportive, inclusive culture with career advancement opportunities


 At Aira, we believe diverse teams build better products. We welcome people from all backgrounds to help us create a cleaner energy future.

title: Software Development Engineer, SYE-Client
description:
**Description**
 Join us in revolutionizing how people experience digital entertainment across global platforms. You'll be at the forefront of developing innovative streaming solutions that transform how millions of viewers consume live sports, original shows, and blockbuster movies.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* Develop and optimize client applications and software development kits (SDKs) for seamless video streaming experiences
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement high-performance streaming technologies
* Conduct comprehensive code reviews and provide constructive feedback to enhance software quality
* Investigate and resolve complex technical challenges affecting video playback and user experience
* Drive continuous improvement of streaming platforms across multiple device ecosystems.


 A day in the life
   

  

 Join Amazon Prime Video's streaming low latency organization, working on Sye - our revolutionary streaming platform for live sports. You'll focus on client-side implementation to deliver minimal latency and synchronized playback globally. The ideal candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, effectively managing both short and long-term projects. You'll debug customer-facing issues, conduct deep-dive analysis, and drive improvements in video quality, latency reduction, and bandwidth optimization. Your work will ensure seamless viewing experiences across various network conditions and devices, directly impacting millions of viewers worldwide.
   

  

**About The Team**
 We are a dynamic, collaborative group passionate about creating world-class streaming experiences. Our team values innovation, knowledge sharing, and continuous learning. We're committed to developing talent and creating an inclusive environment where every team member can grow and make meaningful contributions.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
* Experience in professional, non-internship software development
* Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
* Experience with performance optimization and memory management


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
* Experience with full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
* Experience in developing and maintaining applications, frameworks or SDKs for Android, iOS, tvOS, Smart TVs, game consoles or web.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills.
