Spooners in their 20s lead products worth hundreds of millions of dollars. And if you’ve got what it takes, you’ll soon be playing an essential role in major projects, too.
* **Competitive pay and access to equity in the company.** 
 Typically, we offer an individual at the start of their career a salary of £54,545 in the UK and €52,246 elsewhere. If they possess a few years of relevant experience, the salary on offer tends to be between £66,779 and £149,636 in the UK, and €63,965 and €143,330 elsewhere. Pay grows rapidly as you accumulate experience and translate it into greater impact. You can also receive some of your pay in company equity at a discounted price, thus participating in the value creation we achieve together. If relocating to Italy, you may enjoy a 50% tax cut.
* **All. These. Benefits.** 
 Flexible hours, remote working, unlimited backing for learning and training, top-of-the-market health insurance, a rich relocation package, generous parental support, and a yearly retreat to a stunning location. We help each Spooner set up the conditions to do their best work.


**Commitment & contract**
 Permanent or fixed-term. Full-time.
   

  

**Location**
 Milan (Italy), London (UK) or remote.
   

  

**Before you apply**
 Bending Spoons is a demanding environment: We’re extremely ambitious and we hold ourselves—and one another—to a high standard. While this tends to lead to extraordinary learning, achievement, and career growth, it also requires significant commitment.
   

  

 To help you ramp up quickly and set yourself up for success, we recommend spending your first few months working from our Milan office, regardless of your long-term work location. It’s the best way to rapidly absorb our company culture and build trust with your new teammates. We’ll support you with generous travel and accommodation assistance.
   

  

 After that, you’re welcome to work from our offices in Milan or London, or remotely from approved countries—depending on what we agree at the offer stage.
   

  

 If the role speaks to you and you’re excited to give your best, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now—we can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

**The selection process**
 If you pass our screening, we’ll ask you to take on a few tests that assess how you approach unfamiliar problems. If you’re successful with those, we’ll invite you to a series of interviews.
   

  

 Bending Spoons is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider for employment any applicant and we provide reasonable accommodations for an applicant with disabilities, which can be requested through this form.
   

  

 Studies suggest that women tend not to apply for a job if their CV isn’t a perfect fit. Here, talent takes precedence over experience. So if you like the role and think you could be awesome at it in time, go ahead and apply.

title: Digital Workplace Transformation Leader - Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 – Industry Principal /Digital Workplace Transformation Leader
   

  

**Skill** 
 - Digital Workplace Transformation
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.
* Lead large digital workplace transformation programs as a trusted Technology advisor to clients working with multiple client stakeholders, business groups and service providers.
* Provide best-fit architectural solutions, technology consultation, assist in defining scope and sizing of work, create technology differentiation to ensure high quality technical solutions and thought leadership for digital workplace.
* Manage a range of stakeholders and subject matter experts to ensure alignment to business needs.
* Liase with various integration forums and internal governance committees
* Strategic and Large deal advisory – Lead integrated solutions for large proposals or client programs (digital workplace).
* Program manage large consulting/advisory engagements for digital workplace.


**Required - Mandatory:**
* Experience in IT .
* A Digital Workplace Technology strategist and evangelist who specializes in leading organizations through digital transformation by leveraging emerging technology and articulating the strategy to deliver new products, business paradigms and ecosystem partnerships that enable growth and increase operational efficiency.
* Well versed with Industry Standards, OEM Standards, and Service Offerings in the “Digital Workplace” domain to be able to provide solution advisory and transformation strategy.
* Experience across the breadth of Digital Workplace Technology domains in Three or more of the below service offering domains –


 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).
   

  

**Personal**
 Besides the professional qualifications of the candidates, we place great importance in addition to various forms personality profile. These include:
   

  

* Excellent in Verbal, written communication.
* Strong stakeholder management and negotiation skills to be able to influence or manage difficult stakeholders both internal and external – partners, service providers and customers.
* Willingness and flexibility to learn new technologies (learnability, having a pulse on industry trends), scale up quickly and adapt to different roles as the situation demands.


**Why Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.

title: Assignment Period:
description:
We are currently seeking three experienced Fullstack Agile Engineers to join a dedicated DevOps team. As a Fullstack Agile Engineer, you will play a vital role in developing and designing robust IT solutions, acting as a bridge between business and technical knowledge, and contributing to the overall development process.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and develop sustainable IT solutions that are both reliable and efficient.
* Serve as the link between technical and business knowledge, ensuring smooth communication and solution alignment.
* Translate user stories into detailed technical solutions and integration designs, adhering to architecture guidelines.
* Collaborate closely with software developers, UX designers, business experts, and the Product Owner to deliver high-quality solutions.
* Work alongside IT Solution Architects and Solution Designers to ensure technical coherence and alignment with the company’s IT framework.
* Refine and review business requirements to optimize infrastructure usage and IT systems.
* Ensure that software development follows industry best practices and coding standards.
* Contribute to the team’s Agile norms and software design practices, ensuring high standards for solution development.
* Implement secure software development practices and ensure security protocols are followed throughout the software lifecycle.
* Promote and advocate for best practices in application solutions and application security within the IT team.
* Share knowledge of software development and solution design best practices with team members to foster continuous improvement.


**Required Skills**
* Over 5 years of experience in software development, with a focus on full-stack development.
* Proficient in the following tech stack: Angular 15+, HTML, CSS, TypeScript, JavaScript, .NET Core, and Microsoft Azure Cloud solutions.
* Solid experience with Optimizely (formerly EpiServer CMS) development.
* Familiarity with MS DevOps, MS Visual Studio, Git, and GitFlow.
* Experience with DAST (Dynamic Application Security Testing) and SAST (Static Application Security Testing) tools.
* Strong experience with automatic unit and integration testing.
* A passion for driving value-creating software development and fostering innovation.
* Fluency in both Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* At least 3 years of experience working within Agile frameworks and Agile software development methodologies.
* Experience with Solution Design and IT architecture, especially within web and cloud solutions, is a plus.
* Proficient in API design and management.


 If you are a driven and experienced Fullstack Agile Engineer, eager to contribute to innovative IT solutions, we look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**About Rasulson Consulting**
 Rasulson Consulting is a specialized staffing and recruitment firm focused on the IT sector. We collaborate with leading tech companies and innovative startups to provide exciting career opportunities for individuals passionate about digital development. With our deep technical expertise and extensive network, we efficiently match the right talents with the right assignments. At Rasulson Consulting, you’ll receive personalized guidance, regular feedback, and the chance to take the next step in your IT career.

title: Staff Data Scientist
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 


* Top
 **20** 
 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s
 **#1** 
 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **450** 
 million active users per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of
 **400** 
 people from
 **~35** 
 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.



  





**As a Staff Data Scientist for the Search team** 
 , you’ll lead high-impact initiatives that directly shape user experiences across core features like Caller ID, Spam & Fraud Protection, and Name Resolution. Your work will drive innovation in spam detection, name accuracy, and large-scale experimentation. Ideal for someone who excels at the crossroads of data science, product, and engineering, leveraging ML, stats, and data engineering to solve meaningful, real-world problems.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




* Exploring the problem space and finding data science solutions that provide step increases in customer experience.
* Planning data science work for the team, with an emphasis on collaboration to achieve common goals.
* Lead efforts to detect and prevent spam, ensuring user safety and platform trust.
* Drive the development and optimization of name election algorithms to improve identity accuracy.
* Design and run large-scale experiments to improve user experience and feature performance.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with product, engineering, and analytics teams to implement data-driven solutions.
* Translate complex data insights into clear strategies and actions.



  





**What you bring in:** 



* **Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science** 
 , Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field.
* **At least 7 years of experience** 
 in using data science and machine learning to solve real-world problems
* A track record
 **leading data science projects** 
 in a team, collaborating in planning, coding, and communication
* Excellent programming skills in
 **Python, SQL**
* Solid understanding and experience with the
 **tooling for Python** 
 - IDEs, unit testing frameworks, and static code checks
* **Excellent communication** 
 and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to non-technical stakeholders
* **Strong problem-solving skills** 
 and a results-oriented mindset
* Customer obsession
* Able to own and drive projects and products to production and iteratively improve them over time



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Understanding how to query very large data efficiently (we use BigQuery)
* Experience collaborating with C-suite executives
* Experience with data from mobile applications
* Experience with data visualization and reporting tools, such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI (we use Looker)
* Solid understanding of engineering requirements necessary to put machine learning solutions into production and scale them to hundreds of millions of customers



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you fancy most within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, now and then, check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

title: Senior Technical Producer
description:
Avalanche Studios Group is hiring a Senior Technical Producer to our central technology organization, Central Tech.
   

  

**The Position**
 Central Tech is our core technology team and we innovate in areas that push the boundaries for what open-world sandbox gaming means as well as improve, optimize, and support our existing core technology. In this role, you will help develop, champion, and communicate the product vision with the management and director groups to build and maintain a strong team spirit and a highly collaborative, productive environment.
   

  

 You will be primarily responsible for monitoring the progress of cross-disciplined teams and maintaining the schedule and backlog. Your work in coordinating resources and goals alongside the PO and discipline leads will ensure the successful completion of milestones and deliveries.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Take responsibility for the team’s deliverables.
* Act as a point of contact for the project, you’ll manage the collaboration with our intern central tech teams and external teams, coordinating our efforts to achieve short and long-term goals.
* Actively assess and manage risks, issues and dependencies that could impact team execution, mitigating or elevating them in a timely manner.
* Collaborate closely with the Technical Directors and PO’s to prioritize and plan the team’s work effectively.
* Take charge of building an effective team, ensuring the right competencies are in place to achieve the team's goals.
* Be responsible for building an effective team. This involves dealing with conflicts, providing feedback, and conducting 1:1’s.
* Champion company and Central Tech guidelines and processes within the team.


**Who You Are**
* A seasoned Technical Project Manager in the tech or gaming industry.
* Skilled in risk and operational management, with a keen eye for identifying potential issues and implementing effective solutions.
* Experience in leading and motivating agile development teams where coaching and mentoring towards success are part of your leadership style.
* Extensive knowledge in Agile/Scrum development methodology.
* Experience with working and coordinating with external departments.
* Experience managing remote and distributed teams.
* Excellent listening and communication skills with the ability to communicate goals, give and receive feedback and requests in a clear, concise manner to internal teams and external stakeholders.
* Collaborative spirit.


*Note: Research shows under-represented groups in the industry (especially women) might not apply to a job if they don’t check off every requirement. At Avalanche, we’re more about your drive to learn and interest in tackling challenges than what’s on your resume! So don’t stress if you don’t tick every box— shoot us your application anyway! Diverse opinions and different experiences are what make our teams so great, not itemized lists of qualifications.*
**The Stockholm location**
 Our Stockholm office is situated in Södermalm, the beating heart of the city’s game industry. It’s a physical representation of our games – the lush vegetation of Just Cause and theHunter: Call of the Wild meets corroded metal straight out of Mad Max. It has everything you need to make it your creative base camp.
   

  

**Our values**
 At Avalanche Studios Group, we create worlds beyond limits. But that’s not exclusive to our games, so we’re committed to developing a diverse and inclusive workplace. All Avalanchers have a shared responsibility to create an open work environment where everyone is treated equally and respectfully. Being part of our world is not contingent on your heritage, your gender, or sexual orientation. It’s all about your passion and creativity.
   

  

**How To Apply**
 To apply for this position, please register below and provide your CV in English. We review applications continuously. All further studio-related information is provided under a non-disclosure agreement.
   

  

*At Avalanche Studios Group we're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our passionate team, but please note that relocation assistance is not available for this role.*

title: Global Web Experience Lead
description:
Are you looking for a role in which you can create something new? ASSA ABLOY Global Solutions is looking for our Global Web Experience Lead, who would be r esponsible for the digital experience and content quality standard across AEM and Adobe Commerce platforms, including governance of web content and Digital Shelf Excellence.
   

  

 Join our Team in this Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What would you do as our Global Web Experience Lead**
 This role governs our digital content operations and experience quality across our global websites and eCommerce platforms, from web pages to product detail content, by developing standards, templates, and best practices for local teams to follow.
   

  

 You will acts as an enabler of SEO, AEO, and Digital Shelf Excellence, ensuring optimized product and content experiences across touchpoints, while supporting consistency, governance, and collaboration between local teams and Group platform owners.
   

  

 You would also:
   

  

* Coordinate web initiatives with business units and Group, including support for new brand or business unit rollouts within AEM.
* Provide hands-on support with the AEM platform, including train and support for local content teams in localization, publishing, best practices, by utilising its capabilities (components, page types, etc.) to the fullest.
* Establish and maintain global guidelines for Digital Shelf Excellence within Adobe Commerce, including product page standards, SEO metadata, visual content templates, and localization principles.
* Support and enable local teams with frameworks, customer journey mapping, audits, and training to ensure high-performing product presentation and web experiences.
* Act as an ambassador for SEO and AEO, enabling technical and content-related best practices (e.g. structured data, crawlability, semantic markup, template usage) to improve findability and organic growth.
* Drive alignment on product content quality across markets in collaboration with local content teams, product development team, and other key stakeholders.
* Act as the “voice of the business” toward Group AEM team (bugs, prioritization).
* Ensure compliance with privacy, accessibility, and digital content standards.


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* Has a marketing degree from University or Business school.
* Has several years of hands-on experience  within digital marketing, content operations, or web publishing in a global B2B setting , as well as with enterprise CMS-platforms (preferably Adobe Experience Manager) and an understanding of SEO and AEO best practices, including structured data, content markup, and findability.
* Is experienced in establishing and maintaining content quality standards across websites and ecommerce platforms.
* Has an understanding of ecommerce content principles such as product page optimization, attribute completeness, and digital merchandising best practices.
* Is proficient with visual tools such as Canva, Photoshop, Figma, or equivalent tools for light asset editing, mock-ups, or creation.
* Has an awareness of emerging tools and trends in AI-powered content creation (e.g. ChatGPT, Firefly, Midjourney).
* Has excellent English and Swedish communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Is able to communicate with various stakeholders at all levels.


 Experience from FMCG, consultancy or a global function within a manufacturing company is considered an advantage.
   

  

**What we offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* Hybrid model of working.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Flexible working hours.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


  

  

**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here!
   

  

  

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Daria Skucha at Daria.Skucha@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Technical Product Manager
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 Canonical's product management team are technologists who have a passion for delivering products and solutions that help shape market demands while elevating open source software everywhere. This is a general application track for the product management positions at Canonical. You will set a clear vision, prioritize work effectively, and ensure the team delivers high-quality products that meet business and user needs. Apply here if you excel at leadership, communication, and technical vision, and believe you can drive product strategy for the business needs of tomorrow. During the interview process we will identify specific software products which would be a good fit for your interests.
   

  

 We believe that open source is transforming the way that enterprises solve their business needs. Although open source has been around for thirty years, it is only now fundamental to every corner of the software landscape. Going forward we believe open source will have an even bigger impact as it moves into specialised vertical markets. Our goal is to make open source easier, more reliable and more secure for deployment and development. We strive to be the provider of 'most software to most companies', starting with Ubuntu but expanding to cover every class of application on every class of compute. To deliver on that ambition, we select product managers for their intellect and strong drive to advance the open source community. Together, we aim to improve open source quality, outreach, and impact. Our product managers set the vision and the direction to ensure teams deliver the right products in the right markets at the right time. They push the boundaries of the technology landscape to identify and deliver products into new and existing market opportunities.
   

  

 Our product managers are technology professionals with a software engineering background who strive to become business executives and entrepreneurs. We discuss strategy, plan product development, drive engagement, and promote the open source way. We oversee the entire product lifecycle from conception to delivery, blending technical expertise, strategic thinking, analytics, project management skills and effective communication to ensure products meet both user needs and business objectives.
   

  

 We have open product manager roles across a wide range of product domains, including:
   

  

* Ubuntu Platform - Our Ubuntu experience on Desktop, Server, Windows (WSL), Multipass, Gaming, Enterprise, & Hardware Enablement
* Ubuntu Pro Services - Our key commercial offerings Ubuntu Pro, Compliance, Standards, Security Engineering, and Managed Services on cloud and on prem
* AI/ML & MLOps - Open source AI/ML solutions, AIOps automation, model lifecycle management, Kubeflow, MLFlow, KServe, and AI infrastructure on cloud and edge
* IoT - Ubuntu on embedded devices and/or edge servers, device management, and robotics
* Cloud - Ubuntu in public and private clouds, promoting automation frameworks, and including technologies such as Kubernetes, MAAS, and LXD
* Telco - Open source for Telco's including technologies and standards related to Core Network, RAN/vRAN, SoNIC, DENT, and SmartNICs
* Finance - Open source solutions for financial institutions including trading platforms, blockchain technologies, regulatory compliance, and AI-driven analytics
* Automotive - Open source solutions for autonomous driving, in-vehicle infotainment, connected vehicles, and compliance with automotive industry standards such as ISO 26262 and ISO 21434
* Application Management - Open source solutions in the enterprise including Observability, IAM, App Stores and technologies such Grafana, GitOps, and Juju Charms


 If your domain of expertise isn't listed above, yet you feel it's relevant to Canonical, then feel free to apply anyway. We will route you to the most suitable team.
   

  

**Location:** 
 These roles are home based in the EMEA time zone. You will be expected to be located in this region.
   

  

 The role entails
   

  

* Lead the product development lifecycle, reviewing the priorities and goals for your product
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams such as engineering, design, marketing, and sales
* Address common challenges across projects, align on priorities, enable informed decisions, and keep business execution on track
* Conduct market research, analyse industry trends, and gather customer feedback to identify opportunities
* Communicate your product vision, status updates, and key decisions to ensure alignment and manage expectations
* Conduct usability testing, analyse user feedback, and iterate on the product to improve the user experience
* Collaborate with marketing, sales, and support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, create product documentation, and provide training
* Contribute to the success of our sales team in winning new opportunities, reviewing customer feedback and participating in customer meetings
* Oversee the work of a product line, ensuring consistency in strategy and execution across different teams
* Facilitate collaboration and resolve conflicts within different teams and across other departments


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Exceptional academic results at high school and university
* Understanding of Linux and the wider open source software community
* Understanding of computer architecture, application development, datacenters, cloud or devices
* Passion to write about technologies and the tech landscape
* A strong work ethic, and personal interests aligned with the open source movement
* Curiosity, and the habit of continuous learning
* A strong sense of ownership
* Problem solving and the ability to innovate
* Outstanding communications skills in English, both verbal and written
* For more senior positions, product management experience in the software industry
* Ability to manage multiple projects or product lines while maintaining focus on key priorities
* Demonstrated leadership in aligning diverse teams and driving consensus around product strategies
* Willingness to travel internationally up to 4 times a year for company events up to two weeks long


**Additional Skills That We Value**
* Familiarity with a particular verticals (e.g. Telco, Finance, Industrial, Automotive)
* Familiarity with the technology ecosystem including Silicon, IHV, ISV, ODM/OEMs, cloud service providers and channel
* Familiarity with cloud native technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker containers & Snaps
* Familiarity with embedded and connected device technology and ecosystems
* Familiarity with networking technologies - ethernet, IPv4 and IPv6, routing, firewalling, overlays such as OVN/OVS, VPNs, SR-IOV, infiniband
* Familiarity with telco networking - RAN, Core, CPE
* Experience in leading distributed teams across different time zones
* Demonstrated ability to foster collaboration and innovation in team settings


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: CRM & Outbound Lead
description:
At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Consumer needs and expectations are constantly evolving, and we want to stay ahead of this development. Strengthening and deepening our long-term relationships with them will be increasingly important to our business.
   

  

 We need to interact more frequently and directly with our consumers, providing them with outstanding experiences no matter how, where or when they encounter our brands and offerings–in store, through service or online.
   

  

 Through the Consumer Direct Interaction organization, we create and maintain meaningful relationships that provide value for consumers whenever they interact with us and encounter our brands and offering–in store, through service or online.
   

  

 As the CRM & Outbound Marketing Lead for BA EA at Electrolux, you will be responsible for the CRM & Outbound marketing communications strategy and operation. Working with key stakeholders across the business to define the outbound strategic direction and align this to the commercial strategy and calendar. You will manage a team responsible and accountable for developing the outbound programs, communication calendars, and marketing automation (e.g. triggered emails) with the key functional leads and developing content briefs accordingly.
   

  

**Key Areas of Responsibilities:**
**Leadership:** 
 You will be leading a team of CRM & Outbound Marketing professionals who will need clear guidance on expectations, objectives, and outcomes. You will provide clarity and ensure that both consumer experience and the business commercial agenda are kept top of mind during the curation and rollout of the outbound communication calendar.
   

  

**Outbound Marketing Strategy & Execution:** 
 Working with the Ecosystem and D2C team you will create the overarching Outbound channel marketing communication strategy. Working closely with the Commercial Areas as well as , Communications planning, Marketing operations, and Content Development teams, developing one holistic master outbound calendar framework for BA EA.
   

  

**Outbound channel strategy and execution.** 
 Take responsibility for the strategic development and execution of a comprehensive channel strategy, ensuring optimal reach and engagement through various communication channels (email, sms, social media etc) to convey the brand's messages and objectives effectively.
   

  

**Outbound management** 
 : Ensure that the content Management processes, and governance mechanisms are in place and checked regularly to ensure Fast, Efficient, and accurate execution and activation of our outbound marketing strategies.
   

  

**Cross-functional collaboration.** 
 You will be responsible for defining and implementing the cross functional collaboration model alongside your key stakeholders within various functions ensuring a close working relationship with Ecosystem, CDI XO and D2C.
   

  

**Core Outbound Metrics:** 
 You will have ultimate responsibility for the core outbound marketing metrics, working with the commercial counterparts in CDI to define, track and improve on our KPI’s.
   

  

**Compliance and Governance.** 
 You will hold responsibility for ensuring regular check ins with our legal teams and DPO’s to ensure that best practices are being adhered to in regards of Consumer Communication, Marketing Opt-in and Data usage across markets
   

  

**Outbound Calendars.** 
 Take responsibility for the Frontloading of all Commercial, Brand and commercial area outbound communication planning and requirements by ensuring the creation of a single communication calendar to allow for early briefing and content development. This should be done in conjunction with Marketing Operations, Ecosystem, D2C & CA’s.
   

  

**Marketing Automation.** 
 Take responsibility for implementing Marketing Automation in outbound communication, optimizing the process to streamline and automate targeted messaging, and enhancing efficiency and effectiveness in engaging with specified audiences.
   

  

**Data Driven.** 
 You will continuously oversee and optimize segmentation and personalization strategies as well as leverage data insights to uncover growth opportunities across Commercial Areas, channels and categories.
   

  

**Consumer Engagement Strategy:** 
 Working cross-functionally you will take the lead on defining the communication strategy to build trust and long-term loyalty with consumers, developing outbound communication plans that create brand affinity and supports the consumer experience journeys during purchasing, servicing, repurchase and ongoing use.
   

  

**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, related field or relevant Business experience with at least 5-8 years of digital marketing experience, focused on digital consumer communication, loyalty, lifecycle marketing and CRM management–ideally in global consumer brands.
* Strong leadership and experience in leading teams across marketing functions and geographies.
* Experience with CRM and email platforms such as Adobe Campaign, Hybris, Itterable, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, and Blueconic.
* Experience with Google Analytics.
* Knowledge of user-centered design principles, UX Design best practices, trends, and latest technologies.
* Excellent written and verbal English communication skills.


**Where you'll be:**
 You will be based at Electrolux HQ in Stockholm.
   

  

**Benefits highlights** 
 :
   

  

* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services.
* Family, health and wellbeing benefits.
* Access to company gym and pool and other sport activities.
* Private Insurance policy
* Additional holidays


 Find out more: Electrolux Group: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux Stockholm HQ: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/sweden

title: Product Area Lead
description:
Voyado is a fast-growing company containing two products, with the mission to deliver a best-of-breed solution that matches every customer's needs. Engage, a data-driven SaaS platform within Marketing Automation, CRM, and Loyalty. Elevate is intelligent software that maps, analyzes, and learns from the visitor's behavior in real time, which allows the e-tailer to present relevant products and offers, adapted to each individual.
   

  

 This is a high-impact role where you will work with our team, Bonnie, in a new high-impact strategic AI initiative, all while being responsible for the direction of our insight and activation, where we help our customers with predictive, explainable, and actionable insights to drive higher personalization and commercial success.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Product Area Lead at Voyado Engage, you will not only set the direction for your area, but you will also take direct responsibility for multiple product teams, acting as a senior product manager. The team you'd be acting as a Senior Product Manager for is our team Bonnie, where you'd get in at the very beginning. Bonnie is an always-on, in-app assistant designed to guide, automate, and take action across our CRM platform.
   

  

 As a Product Area Lead, you will continuously identify and drive opportunities for improvement across the product lifecycle, showing product excellence by coaching others, creating shared standards, and modelling a customer-centric and outcome-driven mindset.
   

  

*Some examples of your responsibilities:*
* Develop a compelling vision and long-term roadmap for your area aligned with Voyados' goals; translate into tactical plans balancing innovation, speed, and stability.
* Leading strategic planning and roadmap discussions with Product Managers and stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with Product Managers, Engineering, UX, Marketing, Sales, Services, and Customer Success to align initiatives and build effective partnerships across the business to make sure we’re aligned and moving forward together.
* Manage product lifecycle end-to-end, from discovery and validation through delivery, launch, and iteration, monitoring KPIs to assess impact and insights.
* Provide mentorship and guidance to senior and experienced product managers, contributing to the growth and development of the product area and teams as a whole.
* Translate complex AI capabilities into user-friendly, robust, and value-bringing product experiences.


 So, who are you?
   

  

 You are a strong communicator, business-oriented, and possess a strategic mindset that enables you to drive meaningful change. In addition to these attributes, you are likely:
   

  

* Senior within Product Management, from roles such as Product Area Lead, Senior Product Manager, Domain Lead, or similar.
* Experienced in defining strategy, roadmaps, and successfully delivering outcomes at scale.
* Experienced in modern product development of B2B products.
* A strong people leader who knows how to coach, empower, and elevate those around you.
* An excellent communicator in English.


 Considering Bonnie is related to our AI initiatives, it would also be meritorious if you have experience in delivering successful AI products, working closely with AI/ML teams, and understanding core concepts around LLMs. And as the area is focusing on activation and insight, it would be highly meritorious if you have experience in analytics, dashboard platforms, or similar.
   

  

**What's in it for you?**
 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers, and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* A high-impact, visible opportunity in a fast-growing SaaS company.
* Opportunity to drive change and make an impact on how we deliver value to our customers
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* 30 days of paid vacation
* And many other perks, of course!


 Ready to join the team?
   

  

 Lovely! Applying is super easy. We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what would be an exciting challenge for you going forward. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let that shine through in your application!
   

  

 Additional information
   

  

 As part of our recruitment process, we conduct a background check on the final candidate. We use background checks from Scandinavian Recruitment Intelligence. Here you can read more about how a background check is done.
   

  

 The summer vacation season is around the corner! We’ll be slower to respond during July, and the interview process will pick up again in mid-August. But don’t hesitate to apply now if you think you’re a great fit; we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 Voyado is the customer experience platform made for retail. We help brands turn every interaction—from first click to repeat purchase—into lasting loyalty.
   

  

 With AI-powered tools for search, personalization, marketing, and loyalty, we make it easy for retailers to grow and connect with customers in smarter ways.
   

  

 Loved by 400+ brands, Voyado is on a mission to become Europe’s most beloved retail companion.

title: AI Product Lead, LearnWith.AI (Remote) - $200,000/year USD
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
Are you passionate about reshaping the educational landscape with the power of AI? Do you want to make a tangible difference in how students learn and succeed? Join us at LearnWith.AI, where we're pioneering personalized learning experiences and seeking innovative minds who thrive in fast-paced environments and are eager to learn.
   

  

 This isn't just about managing a product; it's about achieving specific, measurable outcomes that directly impact students' lives. You'll be given a clear objective tied to real student success, and it's your mission to make it happen and validate it with data. Dive deeply into the educational challenges, transform your insights into structured "Brain Lifts" that enhance both human and AI intelligence, and drive rapid product iterations until the results speak for themselves. You'll be launching impactful features swiftly and refining them with agility.
   

  

 At LearnWith.AI, we're not just adding technology to an outdated system; we're creating a new paradigm. The traditional U.S. education model, built for the average student, is obsolete. Our platform leverages decades of learning science, expertise, and AI-driven coaching to provide personalized instruction on a grand scale. Whether it's aiding a student in recovering from learning setbacks or excelling in their AP exams, we're demonstrating that education can be both tailored and transformative.
   

  

 This role isn't for those who prefer to dwell in abstract strategies or get bogged down in minutiae. If you're waiting for someone to hand you a plan or if you favor defining features over defining success, this may not be the right fit. But if you're eager to tackle real-world challenges, fluent in data, and excited about using AI to enhance your thinking, you'll find your place here.
   

  

 You'll collaborate closely with a dedicated team of engineers, educators, and AI innovators, working directly with founders to make a significant impact on student outcomes. You'll move swiftly, learn passionately, and have concrete evidence that your efforts made a difference in students' learning journeys. If this is the kind of product challenge you've been seeking, apply now. Let's revolutionize education together.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Create Brain Lifts: Develop a dynamic, expert knowledge base that refines AI capabilities, informs decision-making, and demonstrates your domain expertise.
* Implement Product Iterations: Deliver small, data-driven enhancements weekly to steer the product towards achieving measurable outcomes.
* Develop Domain Expertise: Gain an in-depth, structured understanding of a specific field to enable informed decision-making, produce tailored outputs, and communicate with confidence.


**What You Won’t Be Doing**
* Managing product roadmaps or dictating what or how to build.
* Engaging in solution-first product management; instead, focus on becoming a domain expert and understanding user needs.
* Spending an entire month on developing a single feature; aim to deliver new features weekly.
* Creating technical solutions or defining software architecture.


**Basic Requirements**
**AI Product Lead key responsibilities**
* A minimum of 4 years in a product leadership role where you shaped product vision and owned the core problem-solution hypothesis.
* Proven experience in launching at least one successful product (not just a feature or module) that reached real users, initiated from scratch rather than joining mid-development.
* A strong enthusiasm for integrating AI into your daily tasks, such as research, analysis, synthesis, or strategy.


**About LearnWith.AI**
 LearnWith.AI is an edtech startup that leverages AI and subject matter experts to cultivate a new way of learning. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and AI-powered coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn more, learn faster, and learn better - and have fun while doing it. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with us**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $100 USD/hour, which equates to $200,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5599-SE-Stockhol-AIProductLead.006

title: IT-Projektledare
description:
Vi söker en engagerad och erfaren IT-projektledare för att driva en strategiskt viktig förstudie inom området webbstabilitet. Uppdraget handlar om att skapa förutsättningar för en mer robust och skalbar webbplattform som klarar av hög belastning utan att påverkas negativt.
  
Syftet med förstudien är att identifiera vilka tekniska och organisatoriska insatser som krävs för att minimera risken för driftstörningar i samband med trafiktoppar och belastningstoppar. Fokus ligger på både analys, rekommendationer och framtida arbetssätt.
  
  

**Förstudien kommer bland annat att omfatta:****Teknisk analys av nuläge:**  

Identifiera och dokumentera orsakerna till tidigare kapacitetsproblem och systemnedgångar vid belastning.
  
  

**Förbättringsförslag:**  

Utarbeta rekommendationer för hur stabilitet, skalbarhet, säkerhet och övervakningsförmåga kan förbättras. Definiera larm- och indikatorpunkter som möjliggör proaktiv identifiering av ökande belastning.
  
  

**Implementeringsstrategi:**  

Ta fram förslag på hur förbättringarna kan realiseras, inklusive en övergripande plan med uppskattade kostnader och tidsramar.
  
  

**Förändrade rutiner och arbetssätt:**  

Identifiera organisatoriska behov, kommunikationsflöden, ansvarsfördelning och tekniska rutiner som bör etableras för att långsiktigt förebygga störningar vid hög trafik.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Har flerårig erfarenhet av att leda IT-projekt, särskilt i tidiga skeden såsom förstudier och behovsanalyser.
  
Är van att tolka tekniska behov och omsätta dem till strukturerade och praktiska lösningsförslag.
  
Har mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
  
Kan uppvisa ett relevant och tydligt CV som styrker din kompetens i linje med uppdragets krav.
  
  

**Meriterande egenskaper:**  

Erfarenhet av förstudier inom offentlig sektor.
  
Tidigare projektledaruppdrag inom webbplattformar eller IT-infrastruktur.
  
  

**Plats:** Lund
  
**Uppdragsperiod:** 1 oktober 2025 – 1 mars 2026
  
**⏱ Omfattning:** Cirka 25 %
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Senior Lösningsarkitekt
description:
Vi söker en erfaren och strategisk lösningsarkitekt med stark teknisk bredd och särskilt fokus på vårdrelaterade IT-miljöer. Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att forma och driva arkitekturarbetet inom ett större initiativ, där komplexa systemlösningar ska utformas, modelleras och integreras i en miljö med höga krav på tillförlitlighet, säkerhet och samverkan.
  
Uppdraget innebär att ta ansvar för arkitekturfrågor i nära dialog med både verksamhet och tekniska team. Du kommer att delta aktivt i kravställning, leda designarbete, stötta i tekniska dialoger med leverantörer samt bidra till utvecklingen av målarkitekturen. Ett särskilt fokus ligger på modellering av informationsflöden, systemintegrationer och standardisering inom en regional IT-struktur.
  
Vi söker dig som har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att arbeta självständigt i liknande uppdrag, gärna i vårdsektorn eller andra komplexa miljöer. Du har förmåga att sätta dig in i verksamhetens behov, formulera relevanta IT-krav och omsätta dem till hållbara lösningsförslag. Du är bekväm med att hålla i tekniska workshops och att kommunicera tydligt både skriftligt och muntligt.
  
  

**För att lyckas i uppdraget bör du ha:**  

Gedigen erfarenhet av krav- och designarbete i samverkan med verksamhet.
  
Förmåga att koppla samman kliniska behov med IT-stöd ur ett helhetsperspektiv.
  
Stark teknisk kompetens kring teknologier och designmönster i stora och komplexa miljöer.
  
Självständighet och god vana av att driva tekniska uppdrag med tydligt leveransfokus.
  
Förmåga att strukturera och leda tekniska diskussioner samt facilitera workshops.
  
Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift.
  
  

Det är meriterande om du har tidigare erfarenhet från offentlig sektor eller vårdnära IT-projekt, samt insikt i regionala strukturer och målarkitekturinitiativ.
  
Uppdraget pågår mellan 2 september 2025 och 31 augusti 2026.
  
Om Rasulson Consulting
  
Rasulson Consulting är ett specialiserat bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag inom IT-sektorn. Vi samarbetar med ledande tech-bolag och innovativa startupföretag för att erbjuda spännande karriärmöjligheter för dig med intresse för digital utveckling. Genom vår djupa tekniska förståelse och vårt starka nätverk kan vi snabbt matcha rätt kompetenser med rätt uppdrag. Hos oss får du personlig vägledning, regelbunden återkoppling och möjligheten att ta nästa steg i din IT-karriär.

title: Trollhättan Energi söker en IT-infrastrukturtekniker
description:
Trollhättan Energi är inte bara en arbetsplats – det är navet för samhällets livsnödvändiga funktioner. Här jobbar vi med framtidens infrastruktur: el, elnät, IoT, fibernät, rent dricksvatten, renar avloppsvatten, energieffektiva lösningar och återvinning i hög klass. Du blir en del av ett team som verkligen gör skillnad – varje dag, året om. Vi kopplar samman människor, säkrar tillgången till vatten i varje kran och ser till att digitala flöden aldrig stannar. Hos oss får du kombinera teknik och samhällsnytta med innovation och utveckling, i en miljö där du både kan växa och bidra på riktigt. Kort sagt – vi jobbar med det som får hela Trollhättan att fungera, och vi är stolta över det.


Vill du bidra med din kraft och energi som IT-infrastrukturtekniker så är du varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

**Ditt uppdrag**
----------------


Som IT-infrastrukturtekniker hos oss ansvarar du för att ta fram nya lösningar, drift, förvaltning och utveckling av vår IT-miljö. Ditt arbete innebär att hantera, installera och underhålla brandväggar, servrar, switchar, nätverk och backup-lösningar för att säkerställa en stabil, säker och tillgänglig IT-infrastruktur. Du kommer även att övervaka, felsöka och dokumentera våra system, och arbeta förebyggande för att minimera driftstörningar. En viktig del är att se till att våra IT-system uppfyller säkerhetskrav, inklusive lagstiftningen kring NIS2, samt att vi ständigt förbättrar vår digitala utveckling inom både IT och OT.

**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**

* Drift och underhåll av nätverk, servrar och säkerhetslösningar
* Design och implementation av nya infrastrukturlösningar
* Hantering av backup- och återställningsrutiner
* Felsökning och övervakning av system
* Dokumentation och rutinskrivning
* Säkerställa att vi har en hög säkerhetsnivå
* Samverkan med andra avdelningar för att förbättra IT- och OT-miljön


Tjänsten är placerad på avdelningen IT och Digital utveckling. Avdelningen består av 13 personer inom våra tre funktioner; IT, OT (Operational Technology) och Digital utveckling. Vi har en blandad IT miljö där vi både driftar system själva och använder oss av molntjänster. I och med att vi är en relativt liten avdelning så hjälps vi åt, stöttar varandra och man får en väldigt god helhetsbild, man är med i hela processerna och har god möjlighet att påverka. Vi använder modern teknik och uppmuntrar certifiering och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.


Vi arbetar nära tillsammans inom avdelningen och har en nära kontakt med bolagets olika verksamheter. Vi ser oss som möjliggörare och vi värderar att ha en god stämning. Det ska helt enkelt vara kul att gå till jobbet!


Då vi arbetar i en bransch som står inför stora förändringar är det viktigt att vi tillsammans arbetar mot en kultur där innovation, lärande och nyfikenhet är nyckelord.

**Vi söker dig som**
--------------------

* Har relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT, eller av arbetsgivaren bedömd likvärdig kompetens
* Har erfarenhet av drift och förvaltning av IT-infrastruktur
* Har kunskap om nätverk, brandväggar, servrar och backup-lösningar
* Brinner för säkerhet och digitalisering
* B-körkort

**Det är meriterande om du har**
--------------------------------

* Certifieringar inom nätverk eller säkerhet (exempelvis Cisco, Fortinet eller liknande)
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med OT-system och lagstiftning som NIS2
* Erfarenhet av scripting eller automatisering, till exempel PowerShell eller Python

**Dina personliga egenskaper**
------------------------------

* Det krävs att du är kvalitetsmedveten, strukturerad och noggrann
* Du är självgående, vetgirig och har en vilja att förbättra för att bidra till verksamhetens utveckling
* Du är flexibel och engagerad i att förbättra vår IT-miljö
* Du är kommunikativ, lösningsorienterad och har ett stort kundfokus
* Du trivs i en miljö där du får testa nya idéer och lösningar
* Trivs med att arbeta både självständigt och i team

**Vi erbjuder bland annat**
---------------------------

* En arbetsplats och ett företag som är omtyckt av både medarbetare och kunder enligt regelbundna medarbetar- och kundundersökningar
* Ett viktigt jobb i en expansiv och utvecklande bransch samt i en organisation som gör skillnad för väldigt många människor inte minst genom vårt stora samhälls- och miljöengagemang
* Ett medelstort företag där spannet mellan beslut och handling är kort
* Möjlighet till flexibel arbetstid
* Möjlighet att jobba viss tid på distans
* En arbetsplats som ligger 5-10 minuters promenadväg från järnvägsstationen i Trollhättan


Läs mer om våra förmåner och hur vi jobbar med hållbarhet och samhällsengagemang här.

**Ansökningsförfarande**
------------------------


För att komma direkt till ansökningsformuläret klicka på **Sök jobbet**.


Önskar du ytterligare information om tjänsten kontakta gärna: Åsa Nordin, IT-chef, telefon: 0520-497596, e-post: asa.nordin@trollhattanenergi.se.


Har du frågor angående ansökningsprocessen kontakta: Lil Larsdotter Krus, telefon 0520-497588.


Din ansökan vill vi ha senast 2025-09-01. Tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.


Om Trollhättan Energi Vi är ett energibolag som ägs av Trollhättans stad. Vi vill vara med och bygga en stad där det är gott att leva genom att erbjuda hållbara produkter och tjänster inom energi, miljö och digital kommunikation. Förutom detta jobbar vi mot ett större mål – att vara den goda kraften för generationer. Vi drivs av att göra Trollhättan och vår omvärld bättre. Vi tror på människor och har tillit till varandras förmåga, olikheter och kunskap. Att överträffa förväntningar och leverera kundupplevelser, se möjligheter och vara affärsmässiga – ja, så vill vi tillsammans med varandra och partners skapa mervärden för människor och verksamheter i vår stad. Idag är vi drygt 200 anställda och har en omsättning på omkring 850 miljoner kronor. Välkommen med din ansökan! Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.

title: Senior IT-projektledare till uppdrag i teknikens framkant
description:
**Om ZoCom**

  

ZoCom är en liten koncern som befinner sig i skärningspunkten mellan utveckling, utbildning och innovation. Vi har funnits sedan 2011 och bedriver en bred konsultverksamhet inom mjukvaruutveckling och utbildning, men bygger även egna produkter inom kryptering, EdTech och hälsovård. Vår webbyrå hjälper dessutom våra kunder med större eller mindre projekt inom webb och sociala medier. Vi befinner oss i Stockholm och Göteborg, men vår verksamhet finns i hela Sverige.

 **Om tjänsten**


Som **Senior IT-projektledare** hos ZoCom kliver du in i en strategiskt viktig roll där du leder våra kunders digitala utvecklingsprojekt från start till mål. Du kommer att vara ansvarig för att planera, driva och följa upp projekt som ofta spänner över både tekniska och verksamhetsnära områden. Ditt arbete innebär att skapa struktur, hantera resurser och säkra leverans med hög kvalitet – i nära dialog med kund och utvecklingsteam.


Vi ser att du har lång erfarenhet av att arbeta i komplexa miljöer och är van att leda både interna och externa team. Du trivs i en miljö där du förväntas ta egna initiativ, bygga förtroende och samtidigt driva på mot tydliga resultat. Rollen innebär både operativ projektledning och strategisk rådgivning – och du är en viktig del av att säkerställa att våra lösningar ger konkret verksamhetsnytta.

 **Om dig**


Du är en trygg och erfaren IT-projektledare som är van att ta ansvar för hela projektlivscykeln – från förstudie till leverans. Du har en stark kommunikativ förmåga, leder med tydlighet och är bekväm i att driva projekt i komplexa organisationer med flera intressenter. Du trivs i gränslandet mellan teknik och verksamhet, och har lätt att få med dig både utvecklingsteam och beslutsfattare.

 **Vi tror att du har**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet som IT-projektledare, gärna i konsultroll
* Erfarenhet av både agila och traditionella projektmodeller (Scrum, Kanban, SAFe, PRINCE2, XLPM, PPS eller liknande)
* God teknisk förståelse för systemutveckling, integrationer eller molntjänster
* Vana att hantera budget, resurser, uppföljning och rapportering till styrgrupp
* Förmåga att arbeta strukturerat, prioritera och driva flera projekt parallellt
* Mycket god kommunikationsförmåga i både svenska och engelska
* Erfarenhet av att leda team och skapa engagemang i förändringsarbete

**Meriterande**

* Certifiering inom projektledning (ex. PMI, IPMA, SAFe, PRINCE2, Scrum Master)

 **Vad du får**


Som konsult via ZoCom får du mer än bara ett uppdrag – du blir en del av ett engagerat och drivet konsultbolag där personlig utveckling och goda relationer står i fokus. Vi erbjuder spännande uppdrag i dynamiska miljöer, personlig matchning utifrån dina mål och kompetenser, samt trygghet och transparens i samarbetet, oavsett om du är anställd eller frilansar. Vi följer dig genom uppdraget och erbjuder stöd, uppföljning och tillgång till ett nätverk av andra kompetenta konsulter. Hos oss är du aldrig bara en resurs – du är en viktig del av teamet.

 **Samarbetsformer**

* Heltid eller deltid enligt överenskommelse
* Anställning eller för dig som vill jobba som underkonsult
* Ersättning enligt överenskommelse

  

För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Theódóra Loftsdóttir på theodora.loftsdottir@zocom.se

description:

title: Senior Software Engineer (Backend Java/AWS)
description:
**Role:** Senior Software Engineer (Backend – Java/AWS)
  
**Seniority Level:** Senior
  
**Location:** Huskvarna, Sweden
  
**Remote Work:** Up to 25% (minimum 3 days/week onsite)
  
**Assignment Period:** 4 August 2025 – 30 August 2026
  
Assignment Description
  
We are looking for a skilled Backend Developer to join a robotics-focused engineering team. In this role, you will contribute to the design, development, and scaling of cloud-based backend services that support the next generation of robotic solutions. You’ll collaborate in a cross-functional environment and build robust microservices within a modern cloud infrastructure.
  
This assignment requires a hybrid work setup, with at least three days per week onsite in Huskvarna.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Design, develop, and maintain backend services using Java (Java 11 or newer)
  
  

Build and manage distributed systems and microservices architectures
  
  

Collaborate with DevOps engineers for deployment and operations using AWS services such as:
  
Lambda
  
  

ECS/EKS
  
  

DynamoDB
  
  

S3
  
  

API Gateway
  
Contribute to infrastructure automation using Terraform or CloudFormation
  
  

Participate in the definition and implementation of CI/CD pipelines and containerized deployments using Docker and Kubernetes
  
  

Conduct code reviews, performance tuning, and maintain high-quality deliverables
  
  

Work within an agile team, contributing to all phases of the development lifecycle
  
  

Required Skills
  
Strong experience in Java (preferably Java 11+)
  
  

Solid hands-on experience with AWS services (Lambda, ECS/EKS, S3, DynamoDB, API Gateway)
  
  

Experience building and maintaining distributed systems and microservices
  
  

Familiarity with CI/CD processes, Docker, and Kubernetes
  
  

Knowledge of infrastructure as code tools such as Terraform or CloudFormation
  
  

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively
  
  

Fluent in English (Swedish proficiency is a plus)
  
  

Ability to work onsite in Huskvarna 3 days per week

title: IT-tekniker till förskoleförvaltningen
description:
Publicerad: 30 juli 2025
Är du intresserad av ett förvaltningsövergripande IT-teknikerjobb och att arbeta centralt i en centraliserad organisation? Vill du tillhöra ett IT- och digitaliseringsteam ca 12 personer? I så fall kan detta vara tjänsten för dig!



Enheten för IT och digitalisering fortsätter att bygga organisationen inför en alltmer intensiv digitalisering av både det pedagogiska och administrativa arbetet. Vi söker nu en IT-tekniker som är redo att axla en viktig roll och vara en del i vårt team. Fokus i rollen kommer att vara grunduppdraget IT-tekniker med fokus ärendehantering, service och support för slutanvändare. Utöver grunduppdraget kommer du även att stötta i projekt kring exempelvis mobilutbyte och implementering av system. Det kan även innebära att agera stöd inom systemhandläggning.



Vi har höga ambitioner och under kommande år kommer vi att upphandla och implementera nya system, kartlägga arbetsprocesser som vi förenklar och förbättrar och anpassa vår service till förskolorna efter deras behov både idag och framåt. En spännande resa, vill du vara med?

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



Med cirka 200 förskolor och cirka 5 000 medarbetare, som alla behöver fungerande system, applikationer, nätverk, datorer, surfplattor och tjänstetelefoner, är vår infrastruktur en kritisk förutsättning för att verksamheten ska fungera smidigt, effektivt och tryggt. Vi arbetar strukturerat och professionellt tillsammans. Grunduppdraget innebär att du löser problem genom att felsöka och åtgärda i exempelvis enklare nätverksproblem, problem med dator eller lärplatta till mobiltelefoner och AVS. Du löser antingen problemen själv eller tar stöd av någon av våra partners som leverantörer eller centrala Malmös stads IT och digitaliseringsavdelning.



Som IT-tekniker hanterar du daglig basis ett mångfacetterat ärendeflöde som bland annat innefattar:


* Fysisk och digital IT-support av bland annat mobiltelefoner, datorer, projektorer samt annan IT-utrustning.
* Administration av mobilabonnemang.
* Beställningar.
* Inventering av beställd utrustning.
* MDM-hantering i Microsoft Azure, Lightspeed och Apple School Manager kopplat till förvaltningens telefoni.
* Olika projekt som berör IT- och digitaliseringsområdet.


Utöver ovan är du även en del i våra större projekt och stöttar och ibland leder IT-tekniskt och hands on förskolorna gällande exempelvis övergång win11, mobilutbyten, implementering av system och Freja eID. Arbetet växlar mellan att vara repetitivt och mångfacetterat beroende projekt. Du behöver trivas med att jobba båda sätten och vilja vara ute mycket förskolor och i främsta rummet ha grunduppdraget IT-tekniker med service och support framför ögonen.

  

**Kvalifikationer**



Vi söker dig som har:


* Eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT.
* Minst två års erfarenhet av att arbeta praktiskt med IT-frågor.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom IT-support.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska, i tal och skrift.
* B-körkort


Meriterande:


* Erfarenhet av arbete centralt, i en centraliserad IT support, i en större organisation.
* Erfarenhet av migreringsarbete, arbete med AV-utrustning samt ärendehantering.


En stor del av uppdraget innebär att pedagogiskt förklara och anpassa dig till målgruppen där många användare upplever IT som komplext och svårt. Man måste gilla att vara ute i verksamheten och pedagogiskt förklara och hjälpa slutanvändare. Att vara skicklig i det tekniska och en problemlösare är en grundförutsättning medans service och bemötande är en styrka vi har som team och inidvidnivå vilket är viktigt att man brinner för och vill vara bäst i klassen i detta uppdraget hos oss. Samtidigt är man administrativt noggrann, organiserad och självgående. Därför tror vi att det är en förutsättning att du har hög social kompetens, serviceförmåga, tålamod och att du inte fastnar i facktermer. Du behöver dagligen kunna översätta och enkelt förklara och beskriva både processer och lösningar för användare som ibland kan känna sig osäkra.



Hos oss är samverkan med teamet och övriga samarbetspartners en framgångsfaktor. Vi söker en inkluderande lagspelare som naturligt r sin kunskap med andra och lika gärna ber om hjälp då det behövs.



Du är ordningsam och strukturerad som person, tycker om att jobba operativt nära slutanvändaren och ser möjligheter framför hinder. Du uppskattar feedback och ser det som en viktig del i att utvecklas i rollen.

  

**Om arbetsplatsen**



Enheten för IT och digitalisering består idag av 12 medarbetare och är placerad avdelningen Kvalitet och utveckling. De närmsta kollegorna är fyra andra IT-tekniker, systemhandläggare/förvaltare och IT-samordnare. enheten finns också projektledare, IT-specialister och en enhetschef som IT-teamet jobbar nära.



Vi jobbar gärna digitalt men trivs bäst tillsammans kontoret i centrala Malmö Lugna gatan 82. Möjlighet till visst distansarbete finns i samråd med närmsta chef. Du rapporterar till enhetschef Josef Holmqvist.



Malmö stads verksamheter är organiserade i 14 förvaltningar. Vårt gemensamma uppdrag är att skapa välfärd och hållbar samhällsutveckling. Tillsammans med Malmöborna utvecklar vi en ännu bättre stad att bo, verka och vara i; olikheter, livserfarenheter och talanger gör Malmö till en smart stad i hjärtat av Europa. Världens kunskap finns här.



Läs om Malmö stad som arbetsgivare här malmo.se/jobb


**Information om tjänsten**



Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning  

Omfattning: Heltid  

Antal tjänster:1  

Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse


**Övrigt**



Observera att vi i Malmö stad tagit bort det personliga brevet från ansökningsprocessen och ersatt det med urvalsfrågor, detta för en mer inkluderande rekryteringsprocess och en effektiv kandidatupplevelse för dig som söker jobb hos oss. Dina svar blir en viktig del i vårt urvalsarbete.



Malmö stad strävar efter att medarbetarna ska representera den mångfald som finns i vår stad. Vi välkomnar därför sökande som kan bidra till att vi som arbetsgivare kan uppfylla Malmöbornas behov.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------
